item.title: Google Play preps a new full-screen app discovery feature and adds more developer tools
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description:
Google Play has a new discovery feature for apps, new ways to acquire users, updates to Play Points, and other enhancements to developer-facing tools.

item.title: Gemini on Android becomes more capable and works with Gmail, Messages, YouTube and more
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description:
Soon, Android users will be able to drag and drop AI-generated images directly into their Gmail, Google Messages and other apps.

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Google gets serious about AI-generated video at Google I/O 2024
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
Google’s gunning for OpenAI’s Sora with Veo, an AI model that can create 1080p video clips around a minute long given a text prompt.  Unveiled on Tuesday at Google’s I/O 2024 developer conference, Veo can capture different visual and cinematic styles, including shots of landscapes and timelapses, and make edits and adjustments to already-generated footage. “We’re exploring […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Gemini comes to Gmail to summarize, draft emails, and more
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description:
In addition to the body of the emails themselves, the feature will also be able to analyze attachments, like PDFs.

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Google is bringing Gemini capabilities to the Google Maps platform
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description:
The summaries are created based on Gemini's analysis of insights from Google Maps’ community of more than 300 million contributors.

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Project IDX, Google’s next-gen IDE, is now in open beta
item.dc:creator: Frederic Lardinois
item.description:
Google says that over 100,000 developers already tried the service.

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Google I/O 2024: Everything announced so far
item.dc:creator: Christine Hall
item.description:
Here are quick hits of the biggest news from the keynote as they are announced.

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Google will use Gemini to detect scams during calls
item.dc:creator: Karyne Levy
item.description:
The system effectively listens for “conversation patterns commonly associated with scams” in-real time. 

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Google announces Gemma 2, a 27B-parameter version of its open model, launching in June
item.dc:creator: Frederic Lardinois
item.description:
The standard Gemma models were only available in 2 billion and 7 billion parameter versions, making this quite a step up.

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Google TalkBack will use Gemini to describe images for blind people
item.dc:creator: Brian Heater
item.description:
This is a great example of a company using generative AI to open its software to more users.

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Google launches Firebase Genkit, a new open source framework for building AI-powered apps
item.dc:creator: Frederic Lardinois
item.description:
Firebase Genkit is an open source framework that enables developers to quickly build AI into new and existing applications.

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Google is building its Gemini Nano AI model into Chrome on the desktop
item.dc:creator: Frederic Lardinois
item.description:
This will enable developers to use the on-device model to power their own AI features.

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Circle to Search is now a better homework helper
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description:
Google's Circle to Search feature will now be able to solve more complex problems across psychics and math word problems. 

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Google experiments with using video to search, thanks to Gemini AI
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description:
People can now search using a video they upload combined with a text query to get an AI overview of the answers they need.

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Google will soon start using GenAI to organize some search results pages
item.dc:creator: Frederic Lardinois
item.description:
A search results page based on generative AI as its ranking mechanism will have wide-reaching consequences for online publishers.

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Google is adding more AI to its search results
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description:
Google has built a custom Gemini model for search to combine real-time information, Google's ranking, long context and multimodal features.

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Google’s next-gen TPUs promise a 4.7x performance boost
item.dc:creator: Frederic Lardinois
item.description:
At its Google I/O developer conference, Google on Tuesday announced the next generation of its Tensor Processing Units (TPU) AI chips.

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Google reveals plans for upgrading AI in the real world through Gemini Live at Google I/O 2024
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
Google is upgrading Gemini, its AI-powered chatbot, with features aimed at making the experience more ambient and contextually useful.

item.title: Google’s image-generating AI gets an upgrade
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
Veo can generate few-seconds-long 1080p video clips given a text prompt.

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Google’s generative AI can now analyze hours of video
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
At Google I/O, Google announced upgrades to Gemini 1.5 Pro, including a bigger context window. .
